availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas J. Trice (Webster County, KY, farmer and soldier (U.S.A.))

body.p: Webster County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of David B. Trice and Araminta Jane Trice. Resident in Hopkins County in 1850. Farmer in Webster County in 1860. Served in 35th Kentucky Volunteers Mounted Infantry regiment (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant from October 2, 1863 to January 25, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 126-127.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 616.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, District 3, p. 214.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1867), 359, 952.
Find A Grave, "Thomas J. Trice (1839-1927)," Memorial #127456709, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/127456709 (accessed May 25, 2018).
